senses.sense_definition: Acronym of People for the Ethical Treatment of Animals, an American animal rights organization.

examples.text: Many celebrities have posed for campaigns organized by <w>PETA</w>.
The activists from <w>PETA</w> protested outside the fashion show.

senses.sense_definition: A female given name of Ancient Greek origin.

examples.text: My cousin <w>Peta</w> is moving to London next year.
<w>Peta</w> introduced herself to the new neighbors.

senses.sense_definition: Acronym of People Eating Tasty Animals, a satirical backronym used to mock the animal rights group.

examples.text: He wore a t-shirt with the logo <w>PETA</w>, but the fine print revealed it was a joke about eating meat.
Critics of the movement sometimes jokingly refer to themselves as members of <w>PETA</w> while enjoying a steak.

senses.sense_definition: Acronym of Philippine Educational Theater Association.

examples.text: The actors from <w>PETA</w> staged a powerful play about social justice in Manila.
She attended a workshop organized by <w>PETA</w> to improve her acting skills.

senses.sense_definition: Initialism of <w>performance</w> <w>task</w>, used in educational contexts.

examples.text: The teacher graded the final <w>PETA</w> for the semester over the weekend.
Students must complete a <w>PETA</w> to demonstrate their understanding of the subject.
